intro: Brickelliastrum villarrealii, commonly known as the Mexican brickellia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, yellow-orange flowers. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Brickelliastrum villarrealii is often found in arid regions and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient soils.
